abilities: can speak and understand only simple words

top.name: Violent Instincts
entries: An ancient rivener attacks the nearest creature when {@condition confused} instead of any other effect, and ignores magical commands compelling them to do anything other than attack.

bot.name: Slaughter Tackle
entries: The ancient rivener Leaps at a target within 30 feet, and then makes one jaws {@action Strike} and one claw {@action Strike} in any order.

bot.name: Squirt Blood
entries: As ikeshti brood-minder.

top.name: Thoughtsense
entries: The contemplative senses all non-mindless creatures at the listed range.

mid.name: Atrophied
entries: A contemplative's limbs are withered and incapable of significant physical exertion. A contemplative can't properly wield a two-handed weapon or object without dedicating its telekinetic powers to supporting the weapon, and even then, it takes a –2 penalty to {@action Strike||Strikes} with such a weapon. It also can't use its spells or fly as long as it wields a two-handed weapon or object.

top.name: Time
entries: {@skill Lore} +31, {@skill Diplomacy} +27, {@skill Medicine} +29, {@skill Nature} +27, {@skill Occultism} +33, {@skill Society} +29

top.name: Temporal Sense
entries: A contemplative meditant can always roll Dimension of {@skill Lore||Time Lore} for initiative.
When it does, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to the roll as it acts on flashes of insight harvested from potential futures.

top.name: Thoughtsense
entries: As contemplative.

mid.name: Atrophied
entries: As contemplative.

bot.name: Temporal Suppression
entries: The contemplative attempts to hinder a target creature's personal flow of time. The target must be within 60 feet, and once targeted must attempt a DC 36 Will save, becoming {@condition slowed||slowed 1} on a failure or {@condition slowed||slowed 2} on a critical failure. Each time an affected creature ends its turn, its {@condition slowed} value decreases by 1. A creature that critically succeeds on their save against Temporal Suppression is temporarily immune to it for 24 hours.

top.name: Temporal Sense
entries: As contemplative meditant.

top.name: Thoughtsense
entries: As contemplative.

mid.name: Atrophied
entries: As contemplative.

bot.name: Project Calm
entries: The contemplative mentor projects a field of perfect calm in a 60-foot emanation. All creatures within the area of effect must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or be unable to take {@condition hostile} actions for 1 round. After using this ability, the contemplative is {@condition drained||drained 1}, or increases its {@condition drained} value by 1 if it was already {@condition drained}. A contemplative mentor can't use this ability if its {@condition drained} value is 3 or more.

bot.name: Temporal Suppression
entries: As contemplative meditant, but DC 40.

creature.name: Crimson Acolyte
items: +2 striking dueling pistol (10 thasteron rounds; Guns & Gears 152)

mid.name: Ageless
entries: The crimson acolyte doesn't age and doesn't need food or drink to survive.

mid.name: Evasion
entries: When the acolyte rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

mid.name: Guarded Movement
entries: The acolyte gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by their movement.

bot.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: The acolyte makes two unarmed {@action Strike||Strikes}, or one unarmed {@action Strike} and a dueling pistol {@action Strike}. If both hit the same creature, combine their damages for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. The acolyte's multiple attack penalty applies normally to these {@action Strike||Strikes}.

bot.name: Thousand Ants Stance
entries: The acolyte takes the stance of thousand ants, a style mimicking the distracting strikes of a swarm of tiny, vicious creatures.

The acolyte can make thousand wounds unarmed attacks. These deal {@damage 1d12} piercing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the backstabber, {@trait forceful}, and {@trait unarmed} traits. While in this stance, if the acolyte successfully Trips a target, the target is {@condition flat-footed} until the start of the target's next turn.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The acolyte deals an extra {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

top.name: Void Shroud
entries: 30 feet. As lich, but DC 35.

mid.name: Counterspell
mid.trigger: A creature casts a spell Dwandek has prepared
entries: As lich.

mid.name: Resist Arcane Magic
mid.trigger: Dwandek attempts a save against an arcane spell but hasn't rolled yet
entries: Dwandek automatically succeeds at his save against the triggering spell.

bot.name: Drain Soul Cage
entries: Dwandek taps into his soul cage's power to cast any arcane spell up to 9th level, even if the spell being cast is not one of his prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.

bot.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: As lich, but DC 38.

bot.name: Unflinching Spellcasting
entries: If a reaction would disrupt Dwandek's spellcasting action, Dwandek attempts a DC {@flatDC 12} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+13} slashing plus {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent mental damage} and stupefying touch

attacks.name: acid spit
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+8} acid plus {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent acid damage}

top.name: Disrupting Aura
entries: 30 feet. Formian mageslayers are surrounded by an aura of disruptive energy that disperses magical energy and makes spellcasting difficult for their enemies. Whenever an enemy creature within the aura attempts to {@action Cast a Spell} or Activate a magic item, they must roll a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check; on a failed check, the spell or activation is lost and the action is wasted. Free action activations disrupted by this aura can't be attempted again until the start of the activating creature's next turn.

top.name: Hive Mind
entries: As formian worker.

mid.name: Spell Resistance
entries: A formian mageslayer takes 15 fewer damage from any arcane or primal spell that causes damage, and 10 less damage from any divine or occult spell that causes damage.

mid.name: Shred Spell
mid.trigger: A creature within the formian mageslayer's disrupting aura that the formian mageslayer can see succeeds at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell} in the aura
entries: The mageslayer attempts to unravel the spell's magic and attempts to counteract the spell. They use their {@skill Arcana} modifier as their counteract modifier with a counteract level of 8. If the formian mageslayer succeeds, they counter the spell and use the dispersed energy to gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to twice the spell's level for 1 minute. If the formian mageslayer critically fails this counteract check, their disrupting aura deactivates for 1 minute.

bot.name: Stupefying Touch
entries: A creature damaged by a mageslayer's claw {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 37 Will save. The creature becomes {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} for 1 hour.

top.name: Hive Mind
entries: As formian worker.

bot.name: Hive Frenzy
entries: The formian queen stirs all formians within range of her telepathy into a frenzy. Each affected formian gains the {@condition quickened} condition for 1 minute, and can use the extra action each round only to {@action Strike} or {@action Stride}.

bot.name: Possess Formian
entries: A formian queen transfers her consciousness to the body of any formian within range of her telepathy to whom she has a line of effect. As long as the queen's consciousness is outside her body, her body is {@condition unconscious} (though she is aware if any damage is dealt to it). An unwilling target can attempt a DC 38 Will saving throw to resist being possessed, but the queen's offspring are part of her hive mind and thus are almost always willing. The queen receives all sensory input from the target creature; she can speak through it, and she can use her own modifier for Intelligence-, Wisdom-, and Charisma-based skill checks. If the target creature is slain or moves to a different plane from the queen's body, the queen returns to her own body immediately and is {@condition stunned||stunned 1}; otherwise, she can return to her own body as a free action, ending the {@trait possession} effect.

bot.name: Telepathic Feedback
entries: The formian queen unleashes a blast of debilitating telepathic feedback, targeting as many creatures as she wishes within range of her telepathy and to whom she has a line of effect.
Targeted creatures must attempt a DC 38 Will save.

Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Telepathic Feedback for 24 hours.
Success: The creature takes {@damage 3d6} mental damage, {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent mental damage}, and is {@condition sickened||sickened 1}.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage, {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent mental damage}, and is {@condition sickened||sickened 2}.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 12d6} mental damage, {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent mental damage}, and is {@condition stunned||stunned 3}. Upon recovering from the {@condition stunned} condition, the creature becomes {@condition sickened||sickened 2}.

top.name: Hive Mind
entries: Formians operate from a shared hive intelligence that allows them to communicate nearly instantaneously. While within telepathic range of at least one other formian from the same hive mind, a formian worker gains a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative checks, {@skill Perception} checks, and saving throws against {@trait mental} effects. If one formian is aware of a combatant, all members of the hive mind within range are aware of it.

mid.name: Able Assistant
entries: When using the {@action Aid} action to assist another formian from the same hive mind within range of its hive link, if the formian worker rolls a success, they get a critical success instead, and if they roll a critical failure, they get a failure instead.

bot.name: Heavy Lifter
entries: Formian workers excel at heavy labor. A formian worker can carry 5 additional bulk beyond the normal limits for their Strength before becoming {@condition encumbered} or overburdened.

mid.name: Dune Dispersal
entries: 15 feet. Ground in the aura is {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain}.

mid.name: Sand Armor
entries: A gluttonworm in contact with a significant body of sand, such as a desert or beach, gains fast healing 10. If the gluttonworm is subject to {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed}, the flowing blood quickly congeals with the sand covering its body, instantly ending the bleed duration and giving the gluttonworm a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the end of its next turn.

mid.name: Inexorable
entries: The gluttonworm recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the {@condition immobilized} condition, and it ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain}.

bot.name: Fast Swallow
bot.trigger: The gluttonworm Grabs a creature, or a creature fails a Reflex save against a Gulping Charge
entries: The gluttonworm uses Swallow Whole.

bot.name: Gulping Charge
entries: The gluttonworm Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures, gulping each creature whose space the worm enters and attempting a body {@action Strike} against each of them. The gluttonworm can use this {@action Strike} on each creature only once in a single use of Gulping Charge. Creatures can attempt a DC 41 basic Reflex save against this damage.

bot.name: Spew Sandstorm
entries: The gluttonworm exhales swirling sand in a 60-foot cone. Creatures in the area must attempt a DC 41 Reflex save. It can't Spew Sandstorm again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

Success: The creature takes {@damage 4d6} slashing damage and {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage from the scouring sand.
Failure: The creature takes {@damage 8d6} slashing damage and {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damage from the sand, and is {@condition dazzled} until the end of its next turn.
Critical Failure: The creature takes {@damage 12d6} slashing damage and {@damage 12d6} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 hour.

bot.name: Swallow Whole
entries: Huge, {@damage 3d10+17} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} slashing, Rupture 36

bot.name: Squirt Blood
entries: The ikeshti squirts blood from one of their eyes at a target within 30 feet. The target must attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Iobane Vision
entries: As Warder-Chief Mpondo.

bot.name: Spear Dance
entries: The Iobane magus makes three spear {@action Strike||Strikes}, each with a range of 10 feet.

bot.name: Spellstrike
entries: As Warder-Chief Mpondo.

top.name: Consume Objects
entries: A khefak can gain nourishment by eating objects with hardness 10 or lower. When attacking an object with its mandibles, it ignores the first 10 points of that object's Hardness.

creature.name: King of Biting Ants

attacks.name: tendril
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+15} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent piercing damage} plus swarming bites

mid.name: Counterspell
mid.trigger: A creature Casts a Spell the King of Biting Ants knows
entries: The King of Biting Ants expends a spell slot to counter the triggering creature's casting. The King of Biting Ants loses his spell slot as if he had cast the triggering spell. He then attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

mid.name: Discorporate When the King of Biting
entries: Ants is reduced to 0 HP, he discorporates, and the component ants that make up his body disperse in every direction. If even a single ant escapes, the King of Biting Ants will eventually reform using a process that typically takes {@dice 1d10} days.
Applying area damage immediately after the King of Biting Ants is killed prevents his return.

bot.name: Squirming Embrace
entries: The King of

bot.name: Biting Ants
entries: Strides to a creature, ends h i s movement sharing a space with it, and deals {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and {@damage 3d8} poison damage to it (DC 39 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails this save also takes {@damage 2d8} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent piercing damage}.

bot.name: Swarm Shape
entries: The King of Biting Ants collapses into a shapeless swarm of ants. He drops all held, worn, and carried items. While discorporated, The

bot.name: King of Biting
entries: Ants can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but he can move through areas small enough for his individual ants to fit without having to {@action Squeeze}.
He can use the same action to coalesce back into his normal form.

bot.name: Swarming Bites
entries: While a creature is taking {@condition persistent damage ||persistent piercing damage} from the King of Biting Ants's tendril

bot.name: Strike or Squirming
entries: Embrace, or while within a visions of danger area that it has not disbelieved, it is also {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1}. If the creature attempts a concentrate or manipulate action while affected, it must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or the action is lost; roll the check after spending the action, but before {@trait any} effects are applied.

creature.description: Male worm that walks sorcerer (Pathfinder Bestiary 2 296)

bot.name: Iobane Vision
entries: Warder-Chief Mpondo can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as though they are {@condition concealed}. When he Seeks or Senses Motive, he can roll twice and take the higher result.

bot.name: Warder-Chief Mpondo Casts a
entries: Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell do not occur immediately but are imbued into the attack instead. Mpondo makes a melee {@action Strike}. The spell is coupled with the attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the {@action Strike} and the spell. This counts as two attacks for Mpondo's multiple attack penalty, but don't apply the penalty until after he has completed the {@action Spellstrike|SoM}.

bot.name: After
entries: Mpondo uses {@action Spellstrike|SoM}, he can't do so again until he recharges his {@action Spellstrike|SoM} as a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait. Mpondo also recharges his {@action Spellstrike|SoM} when he casts a conflux spell.

mid.name: Otherworldly Mind
entries: Whenever a creature targets the ravager of Tindalos with a {@trait mental} effect, that creature takes {@damage 9d6} mental damage (DC 40 basic Will save). On a critical failure, it also becomes {@condition confused} for 1 minute.

mid.name: Ripping Gaze
entries: 60 feet. As hound of Tindalos, but DC 37 and {@dice 9d6} damage.

mid.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
entries: As hound of Tindalos.

bot.name: Angled Entry
entries: As hound of Tindalos.

bot.name: Ferocious Bites
entries: The ravager of Tindalos makes three {@action Strike||Strikes} with its jaws attack. Each {@action Strike} must be against a different opponent within its reach. Each attack counts toward the ravager's multiple attack penalty, but does not increase its penalty until it has made all the attacks.

top.name: Four-Armed
entries: Shobhad enforcers have four powerful arms.

They can {@action Interact} with and manipulate objects or perform combat maneuvers that require a free hand such as grabbing or tripping, even while wielding a two-handed weapon or carrying an object in two hands.

bot.name: Brutal Blows
bot.requirements: The shobhad enforcer has at least two free hands
entries: The shobhad enforcer makes a fist {@action Strike} against an adjacent creature. If the {@action Strike} hits, the enforcer automatically Grapples its target and makes a second fist {@action Strike} with the following success conditions. The second {@action Strike} applies the enforcer's multiple attack penalty normally.

Critical Success: The target is {@condition stunned||stunned 1}, and {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} for 1 round.
Success: The target is {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} for 1 round.

attacks.name: longrifle
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+9} bludgeoning; this includes the additional damage from kickback

top.name: Four-Armed
entries: As shobhad enforcer.

bot.name: Sniping Shot
entries: The shobhad sniper makes a {@action Strike} with their longrifle, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to this {@action Strike}'s attack roll and ignoring the target's concealment.

bot.name: Sniper's Devastation
entries: The shobhad sniper makes a fist {@action Strike} against a Medium or smaller creature. If this attack is successful, the shobhad sniper deals no damage, but they immediately Grab and throw their target up to 30 feet in a direction of their choice and then make a ranged {@action Strike} with their longrifle against the target, after which the target falls {@condition prone} in the designated location.
As normal, the creature doesn't take any additional falling damage from the throw.

mid.name: Nimble Dodge
mid.requirements: Skartitch can't use this reaction while {@condition encumbered}
mid.trigger: Skartitch is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature she can see
entries: Skartitch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to her Armor Class against the triggering attack.

bot.name: Cunning Discernment
entries: Skartitch attempts a {@action Recall Knowledge} check against an opponent using the standard DC for a creature of that level. On a success, that opponent is {@condition flat-footed} against Skartitch's attacks until the start of her next turn; on a critical success, the opponent is {@condition flat-footed} against Skartitch's attacks for 1 minute.

bot.name: Deadly Deception
entries: Skartitch attempts a {@skill Deception} check to {@action Feint} against an opponent she can see. On a success, Skartitch can immediately {@action Strike} with one unarmed attack and one ranged weapon attack against the target. The ranged attack does not trigger reactions from the target of the {@action Feint}. Both of these attacks count toward her multiple attack penalty, but do not apply the penalty until both attacks are completed.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Skartitch deals an extra {@damage 4d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

creature.name: Sparkeater
creature.description: His melee {@action Strike||Strikes} have a reach of only 5 feet, and he lacks the Ravenous Repast ability, as he was never a ravener in the first place.

bot.name: Paralysis
entries: A living creature hit by a mohrg's tongue {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns. The DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.

mid.name: Mohrg Spawn
entries: A living creature slain by a mohrg that had a lower level than the mohrg rises as a mohrg spawn (Pathfinder Bestiary 2 172) after {@dice 1d4} rounds, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under the command of the mohrg that created it. If the creator of the mohrg spawn is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.

bot.name: Cruel Reactions
entries: Taon gains an extra reaction each round that can be used only to make an {@action Attack of Opportunity}.

bot.name: Paralysis
entries: A living creature hit by Taon's tongue {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.

top.name: Consume Objects
entries: As khefak scuttler.

top.name: Radiation Aura
entries: 10 feet. Thasteron khefaks convert radioactive minerals they eat into thasteron, a combustive fuel (page 77). The more radioactive elements of the material concentrates in their chitin and taints the air around them. A creature who begins their turn within this aura must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude saving throw or become {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Bone-Shattering Cry
entries: Tollvych cries out in pain as his body twists and grinds into horrific, distorted shapes. All creatures within a 30-foot emanation take {@damage 16d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 36 basic Reflex save) as the sound of the Bone-Shattering Cry shakes and shatters their own bones.
Tollvych can't use Bone-Shattering Cry for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Frightful Moan
entries: Tollvych laments his fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a DC 36 Will save. On a failure, a creature becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 2} (or {@condition frightened||frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to Tollvych's frightful moan for 1 minute.

resistances.name: or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)
